Pre-Game Insights: Sacramento Kings come into the matchup against Miami Heat as winners of four straight games.
The Kings are 9-12 on their home court and 9-6 in games decided by at least 10 points.
The Heat are 7-9 on the road and have a 9-6 record in games decided by at least 10 points.
The Kings are shooting 47.7% from the field this season, 1.2 percentage points higher than the 46.5% the Heat allow to opponents.
The Heat average 14.1 made 3-pointers per game this season, 0.5 fewer makes per game than the Kings give up.
DeMar DeRozan is scoring 20.5 points per game and averaging 3.8 rebounds for the Kings.
Tyler Herro is averaging 23.8 points, 5.5 rebounds and 5.1 assists for the Heat.

In the last 10 games, the Kings are 4-6, averaging 114.8 points, 44.4 rebounds, 27.1 assists, 8.4 steals and 4.3 blocks per game while shooting 46.3% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 115.3 points per game.

In the last 10 games, the Heat are 4-6, averaging 108.2 points, 40.5 rebounds, 25.1 assists, 8.8 steals and 3.7 blocks per game while shooting 46.8% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 112.5 points.
Kings' De'Aaron Fox is out due to a hip injury.
Heat's Dru Smith is out for the season with an Achilles injury, Haywood Highsmith is day to day due to personal reasons, and Josh Richardson is day to day with a heel injury.
